urls.title: Home - Wildlife Ways
urls.description: Wildlife Ways is a ¬£16.8 million programme, part-funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF), to improve Solihull borough for the benefit of people and wildlife. It will include tree, bulb and wildflower planting and make it easier for people wanting to walk and cycle by widening and connecting paths and cycle routes with green spaces.

annotations.normalized_text: 650m of Kingshurst Brook in Chelmsley Wood

tweets.text: Project to re-naturalise 650m of Kingshurst Brook in Chelmsley Wood on track. Narrowed channel = increased water velocity = cleansed gravel bed (4th photo) Funded by EA and ERDF https://t.co/sdweOZi0gu @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @Team4Nature @WKWT @LoveSolihull @SolihullUpdates https://t.co/ha4cVG5rc7
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @SevernUnlocked @CanalRiverTrust Will it work for eels and lampreys? It would be nice to see lateral low-flow areas to help them.

@SevernUnlocked @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup Great initiative. In the meantime, please have a look @Vislift1, They adapt the current in the fish passage in order to offer smaller fish to migrate, plus they provide 24/7 migration and water quality data. Great innovation!

tweets.text: These green strips are the shelter for wildlife and the basis for regeneration.. @NaturalEngland @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency if not us, who? if not now, when? climate and extinction crises are not going away. Own beaver restoration. Let's stop pretending time is on our side. https://t.co/k5gfe2khJk

urls.title: Home - GB non-native species secretariat
urls.description: First published in 2008 and updated in 2015 the GB Invasive Non-native Species Strategy was developed to meet the challenge posed by invasive non-native species in Great Britain. This website provides tools and information for those working to support the strategy.

tweets.text:
It's #PlantHealthWeek! @EnvAgency is working towards eradicating Water Primrose which is invading ponds, lakes, wetlands & waterways. This @InvasiveSp was introduced to the UK as an ornamental aquatic plant & is now banned from sale. For more: https://t.co/5crRIhAQUW
#BePlantWise https://t.co/EcD3WeS2uf

tweets.text: The @InvasiveSp Floating Pennywort has been introduced from America. It can grow up to 20 cm a day & forms dense mats, disrupting the flow of water & the movement of animals. It also impacts the water temperature & dissolved oxygen levels, leading to fish deaths #PlantHealthWeek https://t.co/Ego9xtuyzB

tweets.text:
Our Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd is one of the judges on @BBCWomansHour's Power List 2020.

It'll feature 30 women who are making an outstanding contribution towards improving the world around us.

You can suggest someone who you think deserves to be on the list: https://t.co/oyfWf98cp4 https://t.co/dvj0xXjEj2

tweets.text:
The Green Recovery Challenge Fund is open now for applications. Grants from ¬£50k to ¬£5million are available for England based #nature projects to kick-start the #GreenRecovery from  #COVID19. 
 
Apply at https://t.co/5CHO7Js4pq  @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency https://t.co/YJ4b7WPyLl
